instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognising battery.
threads.message:
Have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has some liquid damage. 
X for the battery status. SDA for the battery is measuring high (5.8v or so) whereas SCL is 3.4V

Never seen that before so it makes me wonder, on another note i replaced the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> to rule that out and there was no difference. 

Im guessing the SMC's all messed up? 
Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognising battery.
threads.message: First you need to fix the 6V on SDA. Probably corrosion under the battery connector, there is no other place where anything over 3.3V is present on that line. I assume that 6V is measured without the battery plugged in.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognising battery.
threads.message:
You were spot on.
Thanks all sorted now.
